items.name: Alerts
_alert_message:
Hello,

This is an automated email notifying site [record-dag-label] that their site has been randomised successfully.

Randomisation date/time: [site_rand_datetime]

Randomisation group: [site_rand_grp]

Kind regards,

NEWS-HEAT

Email addresses can be added to, removed from, or updated on the mailing list for this site by updating the [site_details_arm_3][form-link:notification_email_addresses] form.

items.name: ProjectDashboards
_body:
Depending upon your user role, you may have access to create new records on different 'arms' of the project. Refer to the guidance below for help on how to name/number/format these records. It's also worth noting that terms "Reference Number", "Reference ID", "Record ID", etc all refer to the same thing- the number of each record on REDCap, regardless of if it's a participant in the main trial data arm, a screening log, a site's details, or a site notification email.

Contents

  • Arm 1: Trial Data
  • Arm 2: Screening Logs
  • Arm 3: Sites
  • Arm 4: Site Notification Emails

Arm 1: Trial Data

Structure (hover over each component for a description): 

##
-
####

Valid Reference Number Examples:

Reference Number Description
 01-0001 Site 01's 1st participant
 01-0010 Site 01's 10th participant
 01-0100 Site 01's 100th participant
 01-1000 Site 01's 1000th participant

 

Arm 2: Screening Logs

Structure (hover over each component for a description): 

SL-
##
-
Mon
####

Valid Reference Number Examples:

Reference Number Description
 SL-01-Jan2026 Site 01's January 2026 screening log
 SL-02-Dec2027 Site 02's December 2027 screening log

 

Arm 3: Sites

Note: Site entries will be added by NCTU users (Administrator, Data Management, Data Management +, or Trial Management roles), but naming guidance is included below for guidance completeness.

Structure (hover over each component for a description): 

##

Valid Reference Number Examples:

Reference Number Description
 01 Site 01
 14 Site 14
 28 Site 28

 

Arm 4: Site Notification Emails

Formatting of the reference numbers for this arm is really straightforward. Just a 4-digit number. It's best to number these sequentially, but it's not strictly enforced. These can be added by users with the following roles: Administrator, Data Management, Data Management +, NEWS-HEAT Data Management, NEWS-HEAT Project Management.

Structure (hover over each component for a description): 

####

Valid Reference Number Examples:

Reference Number Description
 0001 First site notification email
 0010 Tenth site notification email
 0100 Hundredth site notification email

items.name: ProjectDashboards
_body:
Below will be some informational sections assisting you in ensuring the usage of the REDCap Mobile App for NEWS-HEAT data capture runs smoothly as possible. 

Contents

  • Setup Instructions
  • Managing REDCap Mobile App user accounts
    • Adding a new user
    • Removing a user
    • Managing a user
  • Pushing and pulling data from the server
  • Issues with sending data to the server
  • Ensuring the project is up to date

Setup Instructions

Research Nurses will have access to install and manage the REDCap Mobile App on the sites' tablets for offline data capture. 

Follow the instructions below to install and set up the REDCap Mobile App.

1) In either Google play or on the App Store (whichever applies to your device), search for "REDCap Mobile App".

2) When viewing the app's page on the store, and prior to installing, make sure to verify the app is correct by verifying the logo/icon, title, category and developer/publisher: 


Figure 1.

The icon/logo of the app should be the same as in Figure 1 (left).

The title of the app should be "REDCap Mobile App".

The category should be "Medical".

The developer or publisher of the app should say "The REDCap Team at Vanderbilt" (Google play) or "Vanderbilt University Medical Center" (App Store).

3) Install the app on your device.

4) Open the app on your device.

5) Below "End-User License Terms for the REDCap Mobile App", tap "Agree".

6) Scroll down. Now you will add user accounts.

The NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse will have two user accounts and should decide on two distinct, unique PINs for these accounts:

Account Type Account User Name Purpose
Administrator admin (automatically set) Creating and managing data collectors
Data Collector Should be the same as the username that the user uses to log into REDCap on the web, e.g. "scastle" Data collection

a) Enter and re-enter the 6-digit Administrator PIN on the left-hand side. 

b) Enter your username under "First Username" on the right-hand side.

c) Enter and re-enter the 6-digit Data Collector PIN on the right-hand side.

d) Tap "Add Admin and User".

e) Now, consider what other user(s), if any, will need access to the app for data collection. These should only be users that have access to add data on the web version of REDCap. To add additional users or update existing ones, follow the instructions in the Managing REDCap Mobile App user accounts section of this page.

7) If in step 6e you added additional users to the project, please Logout (by tapping "Logout" in the top left corner) and log into the NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse's "data collector" user account (should have the same username as what the NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse uses to log into REDCap on the web).

8) Tap the 'Set Up Mobile Project' button.

9) Go to [redcap-base-url] on the web browser, and log into your (NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse) account. Navigate to the "NEWS-HEAT" project (under "My Projects"). Then, on the left hand menu under "Applications", click "REDCap Mobile App".

10) Click "Set Up Project".

11) This step will depend upon whether you're viewing the QR code on the same device as what you just installed the app on or if you're viewing the QR code on a separate device or computer:

Same Device: 

a) Tap "Can't get the QR code to work?" below the QR code.

b) A box will appear titled "Alternative method to set up project:". Copy or jot down the code from the box to the right of "Initialisation code:".

c) Go back into the REDCap Mobile App. Scroll down to "The Alternative Method" and enter the code from the step above into the box next to "Code:" and tap "Submit Code".

Separate Device or Computer:

a) Tap the 'Scan QR Code' button on your device.

b) Scan the QR code using your device.

12) Verify the project you are adding is correct (NEWS-HEAT).

13) The project will automatically begin downloading and processing.

14) Tap "Download All X Records" (if this is shown).

Managing REDCap Mobile App user accounts

Research Nurses will be able to add, remove, or manage users by following the instructions below:

Adding a new user:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) If already logged in, tap "Logout" in the top left corner.

3) Select "admin" for username and enter your admin PIN

4) Tap "Add New User"

5) Enter the user's REDCap username (same as what that user would use to log in on the web version of REDCap) under "Username"

6) Enter and re-enter a 6-digit PIN for the user (best to allow the user to choose a pin that they will find easy to remember)

7) Tap "Add User"

8) If the user is NOT a NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse, please also do the following:

a) Scroll down and, expanding if needed, locate and tap the username of the newly-added user.

b) Uncheck "Allow to setup/remove projects"

c) Scroll down and verify the username in the button "Save Rights for [username]" is correct. If so, tap "Save Rights for [username]"

Removing a user:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) If already logged in, tap "Logout" in the top left corner.

3) Select "admin" for username and enter your admin PIN.

4) Scroll down and, expanding if needed, locate and tap the username of the user you wish to remove.

5) Scroll down and tap "Remove User and Associated Projects".

6) Verify the user shown below "Delete User" is correct. If so, tap "Yes".

Managing a user:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) If already logged in, tap "Logout" in the top left corner.

3) Select "admin" for username and enter your admin PIN.

4) Scroll down and, expanding if needed, locate and tap the username of the user you wish to manage.

If updating user rights, utilize the checkboxes to set user rights as needed. Once done, scroll down and verify the username in the button "Save Rights for [username]" is correct. If so, tap "Save Rights for [username]" for the changes to take effect. 

You can also:

    • Reset the password/PIN
    • Set Up New Mobile Project
    • Send Data Dump for All Projects
    • Remove User and Associated Projects

Pushing and pulling data from the server

It's recommended that the data held on the REDCap Mobile App is updated at least once daily, and that care is taken to avoid working on the same records on both the web version of REDCap and the REDCap Mobile App at the same time to avoid conflicts.

It's also worth noting that, on the app, when it says "saved to database" after adding or updating a record, that this means the database on the device is updated.

Sending data to the actual server so that one can see the data added on the mobile app on the web version of REDCap will ensure this data is visible. During this, you can (and should) also pull updated data from the server.

To do so, follow the instructions below:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) Log in using the Username and PIN

3) Tap "My Projects"

4) Tap "NEWS-HEAT"

5) Check to see if "Send Data to Server" is shown below "Collect Data". 

a) If so, tap "Send Data to Server"

b) Then, tap "Begin Send of All Data"

c) Tap "Yes" for GPS coordinates to be sent

d) Wait for this process to complete. Refer to footnote [1] if any issues with sending data to the server 

e) Then, tap "Options" and tap "Download Records From Server"

f) Tap "Proceed"

g) Tap "Proceed" again (it will have a scary message saying it will delete ALL DATA on the app for this project- so long as pushing data to the server was successful, this won't be an issue- if there are any issues, please refer to the Issues with sending data to the server section of this page)

h) Tap "Download All X Records"

Issues with sending data to the server

If there are any issues with sending data to the server, please take a screenshot or screenshot(s) of the issue, and then follow the instructions below:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) Log in using the Username and PIN

3) Tap "My Projects"

4) Tap "NEWS-HEAT"

5) Scroll down to and tap "Send Emergency Data Dump"

6) Tap "All Records"

7) Tap "Proceed with Emergency Send"

8) Tap "Both" (saving the data dump to both the external REDCap server and to the device)

9) Tap "All Records"

10) Verify that a pop-up appears saying "The document has been successfully uploaded to REDCap". This will ensure no data is lost. 

11) Finally, notify the NEWS-HEAT team and let us know what happened along with your screenshot.

Ensuring the project is up to date

It's important to ensure that the project is up to date. Sites should ensure they update their project's setup and data especially in the following scenarios:

  • The Phase 3B (intervention) start date is updated (intervention/EENC + NEWS-HEAT Care Bundle sites only)
  • A new NEWS-HEAT system release is implemented

To do this, follow the steps below:

1) Open the REDCap Mobile App

2) Log in using the Username and PIN

3) Tap "My Projects"

4) Tap "NEWS-HEAT"

5) Check to see if "Send Data to Server" is shown below "Collect Data". 

a) If so, tap "Send Data to Server"

b) Then, tap "Begin Send of All Data"

c) Tap "Yes" for GPS coordinates to be sent

d) Wait for this process to complete. Refer to footnote [2] if any issues with sending data to the server 

e) Then, tap "Options" and tap "Return to project"

6) Scroll down until you see "Refresh Setup & Data" (Should be below "Sync Archive" and above "Download Server Records")

7) Tap "Refresh Setup & Data"

8) Tap "Proceed"

9) Tap "Proceed" again

10) Tap "Download All X Records" to ensure the Mobile App has up-to-date data

Footnotes

[1] If there are any issues with sending data to the server, please refer to the Issues with sending data to the server section of this page.

[2] If there are any issues with sending data to the server, please refer to the Issues with sending data to the server section of this page. Once you have followed the steps in the Issues with sending data to the server section of this page, you can continue onwards from step 6 in the Ensuring the project is up to date section of this page to finish refreshing the project setup & data.

items.name: ProjectDashboards
_body:
In addition to reviewing the UAT guidelines document, please read through all of the information below prior to testing the system.

New/updated bits and wording since UAT start will be highlighted.

Last updated 18/12/2025

Newer changes will be a darker highlight

Removed text will just have a highlighted red X where the removed text used to be.

Contents

  • Account types and information
  • How to switch roles/Data Access Groups (DAG's)
    • How to switch between different roles
    • How to switch between different Data Access Groups (DAG's)
  • Recommended actions to test the project
    • General User roles
    • Research Nurse role
    • If testing the REDCAP Mobile App
    • Scenarios/Tests
  • Behaviour depending upon phase/randomisation group
  • Bug affecting the REDCap Mobile App
  • Test Sites/Data Access Groups

Each UAT tester will have 2 accounts on the web version of REDCap. 

The base username for your accounts will be either something like mszsnc (for NCTU testers) or your first initial and last name, for non-NCTU testers.

From each account, you can use the role switcher and Data Access Group (DAG) switcher to view the project from different user roles and sites/Data Access Groups (DAGs). Instructions on how to do this are included in the How to switch roles/Data Access Groups (DAG's) section of this page.

Account Type User Roles Account User Name Purpose/Notes
General User - Chief Investigator
- Data Management
- Data Management +
- NEWS-HEAT Data Management
- NEWS-HEAT Project Management
- Principal Investigator
- Sponsor
- Statistician
- Statistician - Unblinded
- Trial Management		 baseusername

Testing of more centralized, non-site-specific functionality as well as functionality while assigned to various site user roles and different site/DAG assignments.
Research Nurse - Research Nurse baseusername_researchnurse Testing of functionality from the Research Nurse role.

 

How to switch roles/DAGs

You will need to use the "Switch Role" page to switch between different user roles and DAGs. You can only do this on the web version of REDCap, not in the REDCap Mobile App, and if you change to a different DAG on your research nurse account, you will need to follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page in order to update the data that you see and the data you can add on the REDCap Mobile App.

To switch between different roles, follow the instructions below:

1) Log into REDCap (on the website, not on the REDCap Mobile App) on the intended account (General User or NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse User).

2) Open the NEWS-HEAT project.

3) On the left-hand side, under "External Modules", click "Switch Role".

4) Use the buttons on the page to switch to your desired role.

To switch between different DAGs (only available when assigned to either the Principal Investigator or Research Nurse roles), follow the instructions below:

1) Log into REDCap (on the website, not on the REDCap Mobile App) on the intended account (General User or NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse User).

2) Open the NEWS-HEAT project.

3) On the top of the page, above the NEWS-HEAT logo, click "Switch" in the blue bar displaying the current Data Access Group.

4) Use the controls on the pop up to switch to your desired DAG and click "Switch".

Recommended actions to test the project

Here are some examples of things you can do to test the project, in addition to the general rundown of "Points to consider/dummy guide when carrying out UAT for all" listed on page 5 of the UAT guidelines document. However, these are just a guide- feel free to further explore the system as desired, but this should cover all of our bases:

General User role:

View the project from the role "Chief Investigator". Do scenario(s):

  • 1

View the project from the role "Data Management". Do scenario(s):

  • 1, 2, 3, 4 

View the project from the role "Data Management +". Do scenario(s):

  • 1, 2, 3, 4 

View the project from the role "NEWS-HEAT Data Management". Do scenario(s):

  • 1, 2, 3, 4, 8

View the project from the role "NEWS-HEAT Project Management". Do scenario(s):

  • 1, 2, 3, 4, 8

View the project from the role "Sponsor". Do scenario(s):

  • 1

View the project from the role "Statistician". Do scenario(s):

  • 11

View the project from the role "Statistician - Unblinded". Do scenario(s):

  • 11

View the project from the role "Trial Management". Do scenario(s):

  • 1, 2, 3, 4 

View the project from the role "Principal Investigator". Do scenario(s):

  • 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10

Research Nurse role:

View the project from the role "NEWS-HEAT Research Nurse". Do scenario(s):

  • 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10

If testing the REDCAP Mobile App:

If you're intending to test the REDCap Mobile App in addition to testing the REDCap project on the web browser, please also refer to REDCap Mobile App Guidance, particularly for setting up the REDCap Mobile App. Bear in mind, to follow the instructions on that page to install and set up the app, you'll need to utilize your "Research Nurse" account. Once installed, you can do scenarios:

  • 1 APP, 2 APP, 3 APP, 4 APP, 5 APP, 6 APP

Scenarios/Tests

# Scenario Details
1 General moseying You're wanting to check in on things. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Have a look at all forms on record 01-0001. Then, Go to Arm 2: Screening Logs. Check over screening log record SL-01-Jun2025. Next, Go to Arm 3: Sites. Look at the forms on the site's record 01. Finally, you are wondering what was sent on a recent site notification email. So, go to the record status dashboard, then Arm 4: Site Notification Emails, and view site notification email record 0001.
2 Trial Data - Record initialization assistance Site 03 is having trouble adding a record with the correct format for a new mother. We can initialize a new record for them. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Look at site 03's current records and add the next participant (e.g. if the last participant added is 03-0004, you'll add a record 03-0005). Create the record, open the "New Record" form and assign it to the DAG 03 (doable via the dropdown next to "Data Access Group" above the top of the data entry form table), mark the form as "Complete" under form status and save.
3 Screening Logs - Record initialization assistance A site is having trouble adding a record with the correct format for a screening log. We can initialize a new record for them. Go to Arm 2: Screening Logs. Looking at what's there now for records, decide on a unique site/month/year combo, e.g. site 05, July 2025. Following the format for naming new screening logs (in my example case, SL-05-Jul2025), create the record, open the "New Record" form and assign it to the DAG of the site you chose (doable via the dropdown next to "Data Access Group" above the top of the data entry form table), mark the form as "Complete" under form status and save.
4 Notification of site(s) You want to send a bulk email to a few sites notifying them of a recent change. Go to Arm 4: Site Notification Emails. Looking at what's there now, add a new record, incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 0001, 0002, 0003, you will create "0004"). Wait for the page to load and for some sites to become selectable. Select one or more sites to contact, add in some additional recipients, a subject, some contents, maybe a blank attachment. Mark as complete and click "Save and Stay". Then, click the "Send Email" button (just above the form status section). You can use the "Site Notification Email Alert Log" under advanced reports to see the output.
5 New eligible baby Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 01. You need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 01. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 01-0001, 01-0002, 01-0003, add record "01-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Verify everything works as expected. X
6 Baby eligibility tinkering Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 01. You need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 01. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 01-0001, 01-0002, 01-0003, and 01-0004, add record "01-0005"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location and "other" selected for birth locations. Then, add an eligible baby to her record, and verify that if any inclusion criteria are not met or any exclusion criteria are met that the baby is ineligible and no further data can be added. Verify everything works as expected.
7 Adding a Screening Log Pick and assign yourself to any DAG, e.g. 01. Go to Arm 2: Screening Logs. Looking at what's there now for records, decide on a unique month/year combo, e.g. July 2025. Following the format for naming new screening logs (in my example case, SL-01-Jul2025), create the record, open the "New Record" form. mark the form as "Complete" under form status, save and go to next form. Then, add data for the screening log. Verify everything works as expected.
8 Site Details tinkering Pick and assign yourself to any DAG other than 01, 02, or 03, e.g. 04. Go to Arm 3: Sites. Open the randomisation form for your chosen DAG. Then, go through each form, tinkering with data and verifying everything works as expected. X
9 NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question not shown Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 02. You need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 02. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 02-0001, 02-0002, 02-0003, add record "02-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record with a birth date before 1 December 2025 and before today, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Verify that the NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question isn't shown and that everything works as expected.
 10 NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question shown Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 02. You need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 02. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 02-0001, 02-0002, 02-0003, add record "02-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record with a birth date on or after 1 December 2025 and before today, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Verify that the NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question is shown and that everything works as expected.
11 Unable to mosey Verify you can't see any data collection forms or data, that all you can do is export and view the data resolution workflow.
1 APP New eligible baby Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 01. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Now, you need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 01 via the app. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 01-0001, 01-0002, 01-0003, add record "01-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Verify everything works as expected. 
2 APP Baby eligibility tinkering Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 01. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Now, you need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 01 via the app. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 01-0001, 01-0002, 01-0003, and 01-0004, add record "01-0005"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location and "other" selected for birth locations. Then, add an eligible baby to her record, and verify that if any inclusion criteria are not met or any exclusion criteria are met that the baby is ineligible and no further data can be added. Verify everything works as expected.
3 APP Adding a Screening Log Pick and assign yourself to any DAG, e.g. 01. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Now, you need to add a screening log for your chosen DAG via the app. Go to Arm 2: Screening Logs. Looking at what's there now for records, decide on a unique month/year combo, e.g. July 2025. Following the format for naming new screening logs (in my example case, SL-01-Jul2025), create the record, open the "New Record" form. mark the form as "Complete" under form status, save and go to next form. Then, add data for the screening log. Verify everything works as expected.
4 APP Site Details tinkering Pick and assign yourself to any DAG other than 01, 02, or 03, e.g. 04. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Then, using the app, go to Arm 3: Sites and go through each form, tinkering with data and verifying everything works as expected.
5 APP NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring - probing questions asked Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 02. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Now, you need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 02 via the app. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 02-0001, 02-0002, 02-0003, add record "02-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record with a birth date before today, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Verify that the NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question is shown and that everything works as expected. Due to the issue with a bug affecting the REDCap Mobile App (detailed in the Bug affecting the REDCap Mobile App section of this page), the baby monitoring form should ask one probing question about the phase at time of birth to discern the site's phase and randomisation allocation group to decide whether or not to show the NEWS-HEAT chart question.
 6 APP NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question not shown Ensure your account is currently assigned to DAG 03. Open the REDCap Mobile App, and follow the "Pushing and pulling data from the server" instructions on the REDCap Mobile App Guidance page to ensure everything is in order. Now, you need to add some data for a mother and her baby to the trial for DAG 03 via the app. Go to Arm 1: Trial Data. Looking at the records currently there, add a new record with the participant number incremented up one (e.g. if there are records 03-0001, 03-0002, 03-0003, add record "03-0004"). Add data for a mother with an eligible birth location, and then add an eligible baby to her record with a birth date before today, and then complete any other forms as desired (the more the merrier). Because site 03 is an EENC only site, no prompts nor the NEWS-HEAT baby monitoring question should be shown.

 

Behaviour depending upon phase/randomisation group

When viewing the Baby Monitoring form for a baby, depending upon the baby's date of birth, the phase of the trial at time of birth, and the randomisation allocation of a given site/data access group, the system will show or hide some questions to discern whether the "Was the NEWS-HEAT chart completed in labour ward/maternity theatre?" question should be displayed and answered.

If, while viewing a baby's monitoring form, the system is able to automatically determine that the current record meets the following criteria:

  • The site WAS in Phase 3b: NEWS-HEAT and comparator implementation phase at time of birth
  • The site IS an intervention site (EENC + NEWS-HEAT Care Bundle)

Then it will show the question: Was the NEWS-HEAT chart completed in labour ward/maternity theatre?

If a user is viewing a baby's monitoring form for a site that is an intervention (EENC plus NEWS-HEAT care bundle) site, and the system is not able to determine whether the baby was born during the intervention phase, for instance, because the Phase 3b start date is empty or unable to be discerned automatically by the database, then the system will ask what stage the trial was in determine if the question should be shown for the currently viewed baby's monitoring form.

There is also a manual override question that can be ticked in order to force the NEWS-HEAT care bundle question to show, which is useful for edge-case scenarios or delays in updating the system when randomisation of sites occurs. This question will be visible and able to be ticked if any of the following apply:

  • The site is unrandomised
  • The site is randomised to EENC + NEWS-HEAT care bundle AND it's indicated by the user that the site was in Phase 3A (Continuation of EENC provision plus NEWS-HEAT care bundle training and roll-out) at time of birth
  • The site is randomised to EENC + NEWS-HEAT care bundle AND the database discerns the baby was NOT born during Phase 3b (NEWS-HEAT and comparator implementation phase)

Bug affecting the REDCap Mobile App

There is an identified bug on the REDCap Mobile App that is affecting the system's ability to discern what a given site's Phase 3b start date is. This is causing some odd behavior on both the Phase Dates and Additional Information form for Sites and resulting in probing questions being asked on the Baby Monitoring form when they shouldn't be.

This bug has been raised with the team that develops and maintains the REDCap Mobile App and is being investigated. The bug results in:

  • The Phase Dates and Additional Information form thinking the Phase 3b start date has been changed, even when it hasn't (resulting in one or more prompts to Refresh the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App to show) - these can be ignored, if the Phase 3b start date hasn't actually been changed
  • The Baby Monitoring form showing probing questions regarding the trial's phase at time of birth even when the system should know this on its own

Further information to follow. Hopefully the bug can be fixed easily and then the system will work as intended/designed without these oddities, but should it be unresolvable, some tweaks may be needed to iron these out to reduce confusion, particularly with the Phase Dates and Additional Information form.

Test Sites/Data Access Groups

The sites below can be used to see how the project will behave for different sites depending upon the randomisation allocation and Phase 3b start date.

Please note that, should you randomise a test site, it'll require me doing a tweak to the codebook for the baby monitoring form for the database to be able to know what the site's randomisation group is. I'll be keeping an eye, but to test changes to the questions shown on the baby monitoring form as regards randomisation group, you're best of being assigned to dags 01, 02 or 03 as I might not be quick enough updating those especially if I'm on AL when you randomise a site.

Please feel free to request additional test hospital sites like sites 04, 05, and 06 if needed by emailing Shelby.Castle@nottingham.ac.uk. I will be doing half-days on the 5th, 8th and 10th of December and will add any additional requested sites during those dates.

items.data: IMPORTANT If the PHASE 3B start date is updated, then the REDCap Mobile App's project setup and data will need to be updated as soon as possible. If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date other than today, then please do the following steps when you are able:  Send the updated data to the server after saving this form. First thing tomorrow, ensure that you do a Refresh of the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App  If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date to today's date, then please do the following steps as soon as possible:  Send the updated data to the server after saving this form. Refresh the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App.  Please refer to the following page for further guidance/instructions: REDCap Mobile App Guidance

items.name: FormattedTranslatedText
items.data:
IMPORTANT

If the PHASE 3B start date is updated, then the REDCap Mobile App's project setup and data will need to be updated as soon as possible.

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date other than today, then please do the following steps when you are able:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • First thing tomorrow, ensure that you do a Refresh of the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date to today's date, then please do the following steps as soon as possible:

  • Send the updated data to the server after saving this form.
  • Open this form on the web version of REDCap and click "Save as Complete".
  • Refresh the Project Setup and Data on the REDCap Mobile App.

Please refer to the following page for further guidance/instructions: REDCap Mobile App Guidance

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date other than today, then please do the following steps when you are able:

If you have updated the PHASE 3B start date to a date to today's date, then please do the following steps as soon as possible:

For further guidance/instructions, please refer to the "REDCap Mobile App Guidance" dashboard page on the web version of REDCap (or the exported PDF version of the dashboard page - which you can save for offline use by viewing the page and clicking "Export as PDF" in the top right corner).

items.data: Site Notification Email This form can be utilized to send emails to selected site(s). The email addresses that the email is sent to are pulled directly from each site's "Notification Email Addresses" form. Using the fields below, specify the subject and content of your email. You can also add attachment(s). Once done, save this form as complete and use the button that appears at the bottom of the page to trigger sending the email.  Once the email has been sent at least once, the subject and content fields will no longer be editable, but you can resend the email by clicking the "Send Email" button at the bottom of the page again.

items.name: FormattedTranslatedText
items.data:
Site Notification Email

This form can be utilized to send emails to selected site(s). The email addresses that the email is sent to are pulled directly from each site's "Notification Email Addresses" form.

Using the fields below, specify the subject and content of your email. You can also add attachment(s). Once done, save this form as complete and use the button that appears at the bottom of the page to trigger sending the email.

Once the email has been sent at least once, the subject and content fields will no longer be editable, but you can resend the email by clicking the "Send Email" button at the bottom of the page again.

items.data: IMPORTANTIt appears that either the senders' email (e.g. who is viewing this form now) or some of the email addresses for the selected site(s) have been updated since this email was last sent on [nemail_sent_date]. items.name: TranslatedText
items.data: IMPORTANTIt appears that some of the email addresses for sites have been updated since this email was last sent on [nemail_sent_date] and, as a result, no emails are defined on the list (this may happen if, for instance, you send an email to site 01 that has one email defined on the list, then remove it, and then return here to try and email that site again). If you are looking to resend this email, please make sure the email list for the site(s) intended to be emailed are up to date, and then click save and stay to save the updated email address list for these sites. Then, so long as some emails are defined for the selected site(s), you will be able to resend the email. Doing so without following these steps may result in an error.

data.label: Enrolment Accrual
data.annotation: Display figures with accumulative for the month.
data.roles_access:
Data Management
Data Management +
Trial Management

data.col_logic:
concat(
if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 0, 'Jan', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 1, 'Feb', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 2, 'Mar', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 3, 'Apr', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 4, 'May', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 5, 'Jun', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 6, 'Jul', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 7, 'Aug', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 8, 'Sep', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 9, 'Oct', if( mod([accumulation-number],12) = 10, 'Nov', 'Dec' ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ),
' ', rounddown([accumulation-number]/12)
)

data.label: Calculated Fields
data.roles_access:
Data Management
Data Management +
Trial Management
data.annotation:
Displays all variables that are 'Calculated Fields'.
Field type = 'Calculated field', or @CALCDATE or @CALCTEXT action tag used.
Data Category, Form Name, Variable Label, Field Name, Derivation

data.sql_query:
SELECT 'Calculated Field' as "Data Category",
       form_name as "Form Name",
       element_label as "Variable Label",
       field_name as "Field Name",
       IF( element_type = 'calc',
           element_enum, 
           IF( INSTR(misc, '@CALCDATE') > 0,
               IF( INSTR(MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc)), '@') > 0,
                   MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc), LOCATE('@', MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc)))),
                   MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCDATE', misc))), 
               IF( INSTR(misc, '@CALCTEXT') > 0,
                   IF( INSTR(MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc)), '@') > 0,
                       MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc), LOCATE('@', MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc)))),
                       MID(misc, LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc)+1, LENGTH(misc) - LOCATE('@CALCTEXT', misc))),
                   '') ) ) as Derivation
FROM redcap_metadata
WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$
      -- AND INSTR(ifnull(misc, ''), '@HIDDEN') = 0 
      AND ( INSTR(misc, '@CALCDATE') <> 0 OR INSTR(misc, '@CALCTEXT') <> 0 OR element_type = 'calc' )

SELECT rand_group AS "Intervention Group", dag_id AS "DAG ID" FROM (
WITH 
sites AS (SELECT * FROM $$DATATABLE$$ WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND field_name = "ref_id_arm3_valid" AND value = 1),
rand_groups AS (SELECT * FROM $$DATATABLE$$ WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND field_name = "site_rand_grp"),
dag_ids AS (SELECT * FROM $$DATATABLE$$ WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND field_name = "__GROUPID__"),

list AS (SELECT DISTINCT
(SELECT value FROM rand_groups AS rg WHERE rg.record = lst.record) AS rand_group,
(SELECT value FROM dag_ids AS di WHERE di.record = lst.record) AS dag_id
FROM sites as lst
)
SELECT * from list ORDER BY rand_group 

) AS tbl

data.label: Data Categories: All
data.roles_access:
Data Management
Data Management +
Trial Management
data.annotation: Data Category, Form Name, Field Label, Field Name, Field Required, Participant Identifier, Category, Identifier Flagged in DB

data.sql_query: SELECT REPLACE(LEFT(misc, IF(INSTR(misc, '@')>0, LOCATE('@', misc), LENGTH(misc))), '@', '') AS 'Data Category', CONCAT('', form_name, '') as 'Form Name', element_label as 'Field Label', field_name as 'Field Name', IF(field_req = 1, 'Yes', 'No') as 'Field Required', IF(INSTR(misc, 'Participant Identifier') > 0, 'Set', 'Not Set') as 'Participant Identifier Category', IF(field_phi = 1, 'Yes', 'No') as 'Identifier Flagged in DB' FROM redcap_metadata WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND ( REPLACE( REPLACE( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( LEFT(misc, IF(INSTR(misc, '@')>0, LOCATE('@', misc), LENGTH(misc))), 'Primary Outcome', ''), 'Primary Outcome Not Primary Analysis', ''), 'Secondary Outcome', ''), 'Other Outcome', ''), 'Core Outcome', ''), 'Health Economics', ''), 'Participant Identifier', ''), 'Randomisation', ''), 'Eligibility', ''), 'Demographics', ''), 'Medical History', ''), 'Data Management', ''), 'Safety Data', ''), 'Regulatory Data', ''), 'Compliance Data', ''), 'Process Outcome', ''), 'Unblinding', ''), 'Derived', ''), 'Miscellaneous', ''), ',',''), ' ',''), '@', ''), '\n', ''), '\r', '') = '' AND REPLACE(LEFT(misc, IF(INSTR(misc, '@')>0, LOCATE('@', misc), LENGTH(misc))), '@', '') <> '' OR ifnull(field_phi, '') = 1) ORDER BY form_name

data.roles_access:

data.annotation: Displays all fields that do not have a Data Category assigned.

data.sql_query: SELECT misc as "Missing Data Category", concat('', form_name,'') as "Form Name", element_label as "Field Label", field_name as "Field Name" FROM redcap_metadata WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND element_label <> 'Complete?' AND INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), '@HIDDEN') = 0 AND NOT( INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Primary Outcome') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Primary Outcome Not Primary Analysis') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Secondary Outcome') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Other Outcome') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Core Outcome') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Health Economics') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Participant Identifier') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Randomisation') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Eligibility') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Demographics') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Medical History') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Data Management') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Safety Data') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Regulatory Data') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Compliance Data') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Process Outcome') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Unblinding') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Derived') <> 0 OR INSTR(IFNULL(misc, ''), 'Miscellaneous') <> 0);

data.annotation: Displays any text in the field annotations that don't match the allowed data category types.

data.sql_query: select misc AS "Unknown Data Category", concat('', form_name,'') as "Form Name", element_label as "Field Label", field_name as "Field Name" FROM redcap_metadata WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND REPLACE( REPLACE( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( REPLACE ( LEFT(misc, IF(INSTR(misc, '@')>0, LOCATE('@', misc), LENGTH(misc))), 'Primary Outcome', ''), 'Primary Outcome Not Primary Analysis', ''), 'Secondary Outcome', ''), 'Other Outcome', ''), 'Core Outcome', ''), 'Health Economics', ''), 'Participant Identifier', ''), 'Randomisation', ''), 'Eligibility', ''), 'Demographics', ''), 'Medical History', ''), 'Data Management', ''), 'Safety Data', ''), 'Regulatory Data', ''), 'Compliance Data', ''), 'Process Outcome', ''), 'Unblinding', ''), 'Derived', ''), 'Miscellaneous', ''), ',',''), ' ',''), '@', ''), '\n', ''), '\r', '') <> ''; -- after stripping off @ACTIONtags and any known data category text, anything left is unknown

data.label: ESendex SMS & Email Alerts Log
data.annotation: Alert ID, Alert Title, Alert Logged Date/Time, Alert Description, Alert Details

data.sql_desc: Shows log of all ESendex module SMS and Email alerts sent.
data.sql_query:
SELECT log.pk as 'Alert ID',  (em_config.value->>'$."alert-title"') AS 'Alert Title',  
 DATE_FORMAT(log.ts,'%d-%m-%Y %h:%i') AS 'Alert logged Date/Time', log.description as 'Alert Description', log.data_values as 'Alert Details'
FROM $$LOGTABLE$$ as log
 INNER JOIN redcap.redcap_external_module_settings as em_config ON em_config.key = concat('p', $$PROJECT$$,  '-alert-config-', log.pk)
WHERE log.project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND sql_log= 'Sending alert'
order by log.pk, log_event_id desc

data.annotation: record, form_name, event, instance, field_name, element_label, value

data.sql_desc: Displays all free text fields not flagged as 'Identifier' for easy review.
data.sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT record, concat('', m.form_name,'') AS form_name, em.descrip AS event, ifnull(d.instance,1) AS instance, d.field_name, m.element_label, d.value FROM $$DATATABLE$$ d INNER JOIN redcap_metadata m ON d.field_name = m.field_name AND d.project_id = m.project_id INNER JOIN redcap_events_metadata em ON d.event_id = em.event_id WHERE d.project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND m.element_type IN ('textarea', 'text') AND isnull(m.element_validation_type) AND m.misc NOT LIKE ('%@HIDDEN%') -- exclusion list may need updating in each project. AND m.field_name NOT IN ('record_id') AND m.field_phi is null ORDER BY d.value

data.label: Instruments with multiple editors
data.roles_access:
Trial Management
Data Management
Data Management +
data.roles_download:
Trial Management
Data Management
Data Management +

data.sql_desc: Shows user details, form, event and instance for those forms edited by more than one user. Does not include a multiple edit if second editor was only setting the form status to complete.
data.sql_query:
select 
	rle.user,
	rui.user_email,
	concat_ws(' ', rui.user_firstname, user_lastname) as userfullname,
	(select form_name from redcap_metadata where project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and field_name=left(rle.data_values, instr(rle.data_values, ' '))) as FormName,
	rle.pk as participant_id,
	rem.descrip as event_name,
	regexp_replace(substring_index(substring_index(rle.sql_log, ';', 1), ' ', -1), "[ ')]+", '') as instance,
	rle.ts,
	rle.data_values 
from 
        $$LOGTABLE$$ rle 
inner join
	redcap_user_information rui on rui.username = rle.user
inner join
	redcap_events_metadata rem on rle.event_id = rem.event_id
where
	project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and page <> 'surveys/index.php' and event <> 'LOCK_RECORD' and
    -- build string to match form_name-pk-event_id-instance in query where >1 user has edited this the same form/participant/event/instance combination.
	concat_ws('-',(select form_name from redcap_metadata where project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and field_name=left(regexp_replace(rle.data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\]+,\n", ''), instr(regexp_replace(rle.data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\],\n", ''), ' '))), rle.pk, rle.event_id, regexp_replace(substring_index(substring_index(rle.sql_log, ';', 1), ' ', -1), "[ ')]+", '') ) in
(select formpkeventid from(select
    count(*) as usercount, 
    userformpkevent.formpkeventid
from
	(select distinct
		user, 
        concat_ws('-', (select form_name as fn from redcap_metadata where project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and field_name=left(regexp_replace(data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\]+,\n", ''), instr(regexp_replace(data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\],\n", ''), ' '))), pk, event_id, regexp_replace(substring_index(substring_index(sql_log, ';', 1), ' ', -1), "[ ')]+", '')) as formpkeventid
	from
		$$LOGTABLE$$
	where
		project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and page = 'DataEntry/index.php' and event = 'UPDATE' and sql_log like 'UPDATE%' and data_values not like concat((select form_name as fn from redcap_metadata where project_id = $$PROJECT$$ and field_name=left(regexp_replace(data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\]+,\n", ''), instr(regexp_replace(data_values, "^\\[instance = [0-9]+\\],\n", ''), ' '))),"_complete = '2'")) as userformpkevent
group by 
	formpkeventid 
having 
	usercount > 1) as table1)
    order by pk, FormName, rle.event_id, instance, ts asc;

data.label: Forms Not Soft Locked
data.annotation: Participant ID, Form name, Form Instance

data.sql_desc:
Displays a list of forms that are not soft-locked
Note: if no data has been entered in the form, i.e. form has never been saved, then the form will not appear in this list.
data.sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT CONCAT('', records.record, '') AS "Participant ID", CONCAT('', metadata.form_name, '') AS 'Form name', IFNULL(data.instance, '1') AS 'Form Instance' FROM redcap_record_list as records INNER JOIN redcap_metadata as metadata ON metadata.project_id = records.project_id INNER JOIN redcap_events_forms as event_forms ON event_forms.form_name = metadata.form_name INNER JOIN $$DATATABLE$$ as data ON data.project_id = records.project_id AND data.record = records.record AND metadata.field_name = data.field_name AND data.event_id = event_forms.event_id LEFT JOIN redcap_locking_data as lock_data ON lock_data.project_id = records.project_id AND lock_data.record = records.record AND lock_data.event_id = data.event_id AND lock_data.form_name = metadata.form_name WHERE records.project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND lock_data.timestamp IS NULL ORDER BY records.record, metadata.form_name, data.instance

data.label: Summary Progress Report
data.roles_access:
Trial Management
Data Management
Data Management +
data.roles_download:
Trial Management
Data Management
Data Management +

data.sql_desc: Displays a summary of participant progress.
data.sql_query:
SELECT * FROM (

WITH sites AS
(
  -- dags data 
  SELECT group_id, group_name FROM redcap_data_access_groups
  WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$  ORDER BY group_name
),
events AS
(
  SELECT event_id AS id, descrip AS name
  FROM redcap_events_metadata JOIN redcap_events_arms ON redcap_events_metadata.arm_id = redcap_events_arms.arm_id
  WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$
),
pt_sites AS
(
  SELECT DISTINCT record, value AS group_id FROM redcap_data
  WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ AND field_name = '__GROUPID__'
),
pt_data AS
(
  SELECT (SELECT group_id FROM pt_sites WHERE pt_sites.record = redcap_data.record) AS group_id, record,
         (SELECT name FROM events WHERE id = event_id) AS event_name, field_name, value
  FROM redcap_data WHERE project_id = $$PROJECT$$ HAVING group_id IS NOT NULL
),
pt_baseline AS
(
  -- sum of completed forms in baseline event
  SELECT group_id,
         sum(if( record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'patient_evaluated_measure_pem_preinjury_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'euroqol_eq5d5l_preinjury_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'patient_evaluated_measure_pem_now_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'euroqol_eq5d5l_now_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'sane_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 ( record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                              WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                              AND field_name = 'promis_upper_extremity_complete' AND value = '2' ) OR
                   record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                              WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                              AND field_name = 'promis_upper_extremity_short_form_complete' AND value = '2' ) ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'randomised_complete' AND value = '2' ) AND
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Baseline'
                            AND field_name = 'adherence_complete' AND value = '2' )
                ,1,0)) AS total
  FROM pt_sites
  GROUP BY group_id
),
pt_treatment AS
(
  -- sum of completed forms in Treatment record event
  SELECT group_id,
         sum(if( record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Treatment record'
                            AND field_name = 'splint_treatment_record_complete' AND value = '2' ) OR
                 record IN( SELECT record FROM pt_data
                            WHERE pt_data.group_id = pt_sites.group_id AND event_name = 'Treatment record'
                            AND field_name = 'surgery_treatment_record_complete' AND value = '2' )
                ,1,0)) AS total
  FROM pt_sites
  GROUP BY group_id
)
-- display site name
SELECT sites.group_name AS Site,
       -- total of participants
       (SELECT count(*) FROM pt_sites WHERE pt_sites.group_id = sites.group_id) AS Participants,
       (SELECT total FROM pt_baseline WHERE pt_baseline.group_id = sites.group_id) AS Baseline,
       (SELECT total FROM pt_treatment WHERE pt_treatment.group_id = sites.group_id) AS `Treatment record`
FROM sites

) AS tbl

data.annotation: User Name, Full Name, User Type (role), User Email, Access Site (DAG)

data.sql_desc: Displays all current system users, including role and DAG membership.
data.sql_query:
SELECT DISTINCT uri.username AS 'User Name', 
       CONCAT(ui.user_firstname, ' ' ,ui.user_lastname) AS 'Full Name', 
       uro.role_name AS 'User Role'  , 
       ui.user_email AS 'User Email',
       if(dag.group_id, dag.group_name, 'All') AS 'DAG Membership'
FROM redcap_user_rights as uri
LEFT JOIN redcap_user_roles as uro ON uro.project_id = uri.project_id AND uro.role_id = uri.role_id
LEFT JOIN redcap_data_access_groups as dag ON dag.project_id = uri.project_id AND dag.group_id = uri.group_id
LEFT JOIN redcap_user_information as ui ON ui.username = uri.username
WHERE uri.project_id=$$PROJECT$$
ORDER BY uro.role_name, dag.group_id;

data.annotation: Change date, Change by user, Change by full name, User, User full name, User email, Action, Role and DAGs

data.sql_desc: Displays all changes to users and role and DAG membership in this project.  Shows: Change date, Change by full name, User, User full name, User email, Action, Role and DAGs
data.sql_query:
SELECT DATE_FORMAT(log.ts, '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s') AS 'Change date',
       log.user AS 'Change by user',
       CONCAT(ui1.user_firstname, ' ' ,ui1.user_lastname) AS 'Change by full name',
       IF(description RLIKE 'DAG Switcher|User Management', ui3.username, log.pk) AS User,
       IF(description RLIKE 'DAG Switcher|User Management',
          CONCAT(ui3.user_firstname, ' ', ui3.user_lastname),
          CONCAT(ui2.user_firstname, ' ' ,ui2.user_lastname)) AS 'User full name',
       IF(description rlike 'DAG Switcher|User Management', ui3.user_email, ui2.user_email) AS 'User email',
       log.description AS Action,
       log.data_values AS 'Role and DAGs'
FROM $$LOGTABLE$$ log
LEFT JOIN redcap_user_information as ui1 ON ui1.username = log.user
LEFT JOIN redcap_user_information as ui2 ON ui2.username = log.pk
LEFT JOIN redcap_user_information as ui3 ON ui3.username = REGEXP_SUBSTR(data_values, "(?<=\')(.*?)(?=\')")
WHERE log.project_id = $$PROJECT$$
      AND log.description LIKE '%user%'
      AND log.description NOT LIKE '%Export users%'
      AND log.description NOT LIKE '%Download user-role assignment%'
      AND log.description NOT LIKE '%View project as user%'
      AND log.description NOT LIKE '%Stop viewing project as user%'
ORDER BY log_event_id DESC;
